page.title: 19CHESS CHAMPION AT ELLISTOWN
page.content: Seven-year-old Andrew Calderwood, who lives in Whitehill Road, Ellistown, has become Britain's youngest chess champion. He won the Lloyds Bank Trophy at a national tournament in London. Andrew finished top of his age group by winning seven out of eight matches. Competitors were invited to the tournament by the British Chess Federation and Andrew was the second youngest there. Andrew's father, Ivan, taught him the game and he says he has progressed by watching other players. The tournament which marked Andrew's first main success was sponsored by Lloyds Bank as part of Â£30,000 worth of backing for young players.
